column4: im having an isse with 2 sound cards in ubuntu.  Currently, I have diabled the on board sound through the bios but something still isn't right.  sometimes when i boot up the computer, the desktop sounds work.  When these work, playing audio files do not work.  asoundconf list reveals that i only have one card M2496.  When i right click on the volume icon from the task bar, select preferences, i see MAUDIO Audiophile 24/96 (Alsa Mixer) o
n the list as well as ICE1712 (OSS Mixer).  Why to I have 2 options in this drop down?  What's going on here...
did you try to blacklist the soundcard that you dont need?
what file should i modify...i'll give it a try
take a look al the output of lsmod in the console
you'll see different drivers/hardware. Try to find the driver that is responsable 4 your soundcards
I see about 12 items on the list related to sound cards
Code: lspci shows, Multimedia audio controller: VIA Technologies Inc. ICE1712 [Envy24]  PCI Multi-Channel I/O Controller (rev 02)
Code: this is the card i want to use

i am afraid to say that i am not to sure what to do here....BUT...the main thing is: you need to find out the exact name of the driver that you do NOT need. Then edit you /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist->here you just need to insert one line that says: blacklist driver/that/you/do/need
if you did this->then just one soundcard will be loaded
thanks for the help.  if i have disabled the onboard sound from the bios, would the driver display in lsmod?
yes----I have 2 soundcards too. I have disabled the onboard sd. But still: it was loaded. I needed to blacklist the driver then the secondary scard worked
just try to find out the exact name of the soundcard driver that is resposible for your devices
see anything here that resembles the dell onboard sound card? http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25835/
man....I need to eat something....don't have time to look for it now. Are you still here in 30minutes?
